adrFormatAddress: 127 E 55th St, Manhattan, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: We needed a breakfast place close before our packed day and this was perfect.  It was in a hotel, but practically priced.  We didn't catch the name of the server, but we were led to a back area (on a cold day but heated) that was cool and had a great vibe.  Really cool area.  Counter service for ordering, but the rest of the visit was served surprisingly to us.  They might have served booze at the hour we were there (and probably did given their name), but we didn't ask, and just had coffee and Naked juice as we had a full day.  Wife had the burrata toast and loved it.  I had the salmon truffle toast and liked it, but I forgot to order the addition of the egg.  I probably would have LOVED it.  Actually, I probably still was on the border of love without the egg.  Still a 5.  My bad, and you should try THAT.  Great, central place before you hit some Midtown sites, and you have a great experience, but are in and out in about 30 minutes or so (unless you booze of course).  Definitely recommend and see you there (next time we are in NYC).

originalText.text:
Good food, but service and wine selection could be better.

They have a list of tapas during the day, which is not the spanish tapas kind, in the sense that they were fairly big and expensive. So you wouldn‚Äôt get like 3-4 per person. One is actually enough.

The wine list was quite disappointing for a ‚Äúwine bar‚Äù, as they only had like 4-5 wines for each type and they were all.. alright at best.

The service was also not that great, the staff was mostly talking to each other so it was super hard for us to get their attention at times.

originalText.text:
One of New York‚Äôs best restaurants in my opinion. Good atmosphere, great service, great food and an amazing wine selection.

Andres was my server and he was so delightful, helpful and knowledgeable. Made the experience so much more enjoyable. Truly had an amazing time here and will be back again for sure.

text.text:
One of New York‚Äôs best restaurants in my opinion. Good atmosphere, great service, great food and an amazing wine selection.

Andres was my server and he was so delightful, helpful and knowledgeable. Made the experience so much more enjoyable. Truly had an amazing time here and will be back again for sure.

originalText.text:
A Hidden Gem ‚Ä¶ We were greeted by our waitress Mabel, who accommodated us without reservations. ( I suggest to make reservations because the place is not too big)
Our table was on the cute covered patio. All the plates we ordered, were excellent, full of flavors, and the Sangria delicious.
Top notch service, ambiance and food.
We had a nice tapas-type of dinner before our Broadway show and it was very satisfying.
